Dwarf Scroll I.Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a red bow

Dwarf Scroll II.Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a green ribbon.

Dwarf Scroll III.Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a blue rope.

Dwarf Scroll IV.Description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a gold chain.
Locations: Any monster (other than Serpent, Skeleton, Wilderness Golem)

Chipped Amphora.Description: An ancient vessel made of ceramic material. Used to transport both dry and wet goods.

Arrowhead.Description: A crudely fashioned point used for hunting.

Ancient Doll.Description: An ancient doll covered in grime. This doll may have been used as a toy, a decoration, or a prop in some kind of ritual.

Elvish Jewelry.Description: Dirty but still beautiful. On the side is a flowing script thought by some to be the ancient language of the elves. No Elvish bones have ever been found.

Chewing Stick.Description: Ancient people chewed on these to keep their teeth clean.

Ornamental Fan.Description: This exquisute fan most likely belonged to a noblewoman. Historians believe that the valley was a popular sixth-era vacation spot for the wealthy.

Dinosaur Egg.Description: A giant dino egg... The entire shell is still intact!

Rare Disc.Description: A heavy black disc studded with peculiar red stones. When you hold it, you're overwhelmed with a feeling of dread.
Locations: Drop from Bats, Shadow rute, or Shadow Shaman

Ancient Sword.Description: It's the remains of an ancient sword. Most of the blade has turned to rust, but the hilt is very finely crafted.

Rusty Spoon.Description: A plain old spoon, probably ten years old. Not very interesting.

Rusty Spur.Description: An old spur that was once attached to a cowboy's boot. People must have been raising animals in this area for many generations.

Rusty Cog.Description: A well preserved cog that must have been part of some ancient machine. This could be dwarven technology.

Chicken Statue.Description: It's a statue of a chicken on a bronze base. The ancient people of this area must have been very fond of chickens.

Ancient Seed.Description: It's a dry old seed from some ancient plant. By all appearances it's long since dead...

Prehistoric Tool.Description: Some kind of gnarly old digging tool.

Dried Starfish.Description: A starfish from the primordial ocean. It's an unusually pristine specimen!

Anchor.Description: It may have belonged to ancient pirates.

Glass Shards.Description: A mixture of glass shards smoothed by centuries of ocean surf. These could have belonged to an ancient mosaic or necklace.

Bone Flute.Description: It's a prehistoric wind instrument carved from an animal's bone. It produces an eerie tone.

Prehistoric Handaxe.Description: One of the earliest tools employed by humans. This "crude" tool was created by striking one rock with another to form a sharp edge.

Dwarvish Helm.Description: It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarves. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites.

Dwarf Gadget.Description: It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works.

Ancient Drum.Description: It's a drum made from wood and animal skin. It has a low, reverberating tone.

Golden Mask.Description: A creepy golden mask probably used in an ancient magic ritual. A socket in the forehead contains a large purple gemstone.

Golden Relic.Description: It's a golden slab with heiroglyphs and pictures emblazoned onto the front.

Prehistoric Scapula.Description: Commonly known as a "shoulder blade"... It's unclear what species it belonged to.

Prehistoric Tibia.Description: A thick and sturdy leg bone.

Prehistoric Skull.Description: This is definitely a mammalian skull.

Skeletal Hand.Description: It's a wonder all these ancient little pieces lasted so long.

Prehistoric Rib.Description: Little gouge marks on the side suggest that this rib was someone's dinner.

Prehistoric Vertebra.Description: A segment of some prehistoric creature's spine.

Skeletal Tail.Description: It's pretty short for a tail.

Nautilus Fossil.Description: This must've washed up ages ago from an ancient coral reef.

Amphibian Fossil.Description: The relatively short hind legs suggest some kind of primordial toad.

Palm Fossil.Description: Palm Fossils are relatively common, but this happens to be a particularly well-preserved specimen.

Trilobite.Description: A long extinct relative of the crab.
